page.title: 12THE SCHOOL
page.content: Rhosgoch primary school, which serves the whole area, was opened just thirty years ago and now has over 50 pupils aged between 4 and 11 years old. It has 3 teachers and numerous peripetetic teachers come in for specialist subjects. Nobody speaks Welsh or studies it, this being an anglicised area. The children study on a formal timetable maths, English, history, geography, science, RI, art, craft and sport. The older pupils also add French to their curriculum. The hobby of the school is entering competions and this adds much money to the government capitation of only Â£400 p.a for the complete education of the school. Meals are cooked on the site and eaten by 42 of the 50 chidren in the school. Only one child qualifies for a free meal.
